Description of incident: The February 1 theft of a contractor's laptop may have exposed client personal and health information.  The laptop was stolen from the car of an out of state contractor working for the Pregnancy Support and Adoption Services program.  It contained personal information that included names, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, dates of birth, driver's license information, health information, family histories, financial statuses and recommendation for readiness to adopt. Individuals who requested a home study in order to adopt a child between 2008 and 2010 were among those affected.
